GALLAHER LIMITED
INCORPORATED IN NORTHERN IRELAND . KINGSWAY . LONDON . WEEB BTG TELEPHONE : 01-242 1200 TELEGRAME : OALTODAC LONDON WCE + TELEX : BEBO5
-SAH J
CL
27 September 1978
Mr C H Stewart Lockhart BAY Westminster Houes 7 Millbank London SWIP 3JE
1) you have any suggestions Will Fer weg Tem ,get
Dear Kit
The results of tho firet METRA study on the relationship between Advertising Expenditure and Total Consumption in the United Kingdom is nearly comploted and will be available to be used by the industry in the second half of October.
The remaining sections in the original study covering other countries in Europe and behind the Iron Curtain will take longer and because of less adequate dotailed data moy vell prove inconclusive although they will to some extent support the UK study.
Responsibility for initiating this study, providing its data or managing it and even more the subsequent use of the report to influence the Commission Governments and informed opinion has boon divided between a number of organisations, companies and individuals in the industry.
1 folt the right answer was for me, after consultation with Ted Wood of Imperial and taking account of the views of the last EEC Consumeriom Working Party, to put forward a paper proposing a course of action with an approximate timetable to you as Chairman of ICOSI Executive Committee with copies to all those involved.
Provided tho proposals are acceptable, I, as a member of the Interim Office, would ensure that the programme was implemented.
My proposals are based on the following judgements:
1 That when the METRA study is completed and the report finalised, it will be of good quality and of significant interest to expert opinion.
2 While it is clear that the METRA conclusion that there is no significant association in the UK between advertising expenditure and total cigarette and hand rolling consumption will be attacked, the METRA study will be able to stand up to such attacks and to detailed scrutiny.
-
50233 0306
Contd ..
HEOISTERED OFFICE: 134 YORE STREET, BELFAST 8TIS NE NEOENTERED NEKBER X240

1) you have any suggestions Will Fer weg Tem ,get

The results of tho firet METRA study on the relationship between Advertising Expenditure and Total Consumption in the United Kingdom is nearly comploted and will be available to be used by the industry in the second half of October.

The remaining sections in the original study covering other countries in Europe and behind the Iron Curtain will take longer and because of less adequate dotailed data moy vell prove inconclusive although they will to some extent support the UK study.

Responsibility for initiating this study, providing its data or managing it and even more the subsequent use of the report to influence the Commission Governments and informed opinion has boon divided between a number of organisations, companies and individuals in the industry.

1 folt the right answer was for me, after consultation with Ted Wood of Imperial and taking account of the views of the last EEC Consumeriom Working Party, to put forward a paper proposing a course of action with an approximate timetable to you as Chairman of ICOSI Executive Committee with copies to all those involved.
Provided tho proposals are acceptable, I, as a member of the Interim Office, would ensure that the programme was implemented.
My proposals are based on the following judgements:
1 That when the METRA study is completed and the report finalised, it will be of good quality and of significant interest to expert opinion.

2 While it is clear that the METRA conclusion that there is no significant association in the UK between advertising expenditure and total cigarette and hand rolling consumption will be attacked, the METRA study will be able to stand up to such attacks and to detailed scrutiny.
